title: Maryhill 2015 Proprietor's Reserve Otis Vineyard Albariño (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Appealing aromas of citrus rind and pear lead to fleshy full-fruit flavors. The alcohol pokes through at times but it still provides enjoyment.

title: Francis Ford Coppola 2014 Votre Santé Cuvée du Patron Chardonnay (California)
description: Unusually dry and lightly astringent, this medium-bodied wine adopts a Burgundy-style label and flavor profile, too. It tastes like toasted almonds and apple skin, and feels steely on the finish.

title: Gimenez Riili 2015 Buenos Hermanos Torrontés (Mendoza)
description: Gritty, slightly grassy aromas are low on fruit. This is light yet composed on the palate, with mild stone-fruit and melon flavors. Modest acidity and equally modest fruit flavors make for a mild easy finish. Drink immediately.

title: Le Macioche 2013  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Aromas of exotic spice, incense and aromatic herb lead the way. On the racy palate, hints of dark spice and cranberry add interest to the wild cherry core while vibrant acidity and supple tannins make it fresh and easy drinking.

title: McManis 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Showy oak aromas meet good fruit and spice flavors in this lively tasting but smooth-textured and medium-bodied wine. Pepper and nutmeg notes accent the black cherry and blackberry.

title: Millbrook 2013 Proprietor's Special Reserve Merlot (New York)
description: Pronounced aromas of char, smoke and bramble lift with time and aeration, revealing prettier notes of fresh herb and red cherry. Plump cherry and berry flavors are supple and concentrated, but have a distinctly green, herbal tone on the midpalate. The finish is marked by a bite of fine-grained but delicately bitter tannins.

title: Millbrook 2015 Unoaked Chardonnay (New York)
description: Zesty orange rind and apple notes take center stage in this unoaked Chardonnay, unadorned by trimmings of wood or spice. Full bodied and ripe, its easygoing style is approachable. Soft acidity marks a plush, slightly clingy finish. Drink now through 2019.

title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection Premier Cru  (Santenay)
description: The wine is soft, fruity and immediately accessible. Red-berry fruit and balanced acidity are paired with red cherry and soft tannins. The wine is juicy and will be ready to drink from late 2017.

title: Nora 2015 Peitán Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Typical Albariño aromas of white peach, white pepper and citrus fruits are about average. Bright citric acidity makes this racy, while salty tangerine, apricot and nectarine flavors end with pithy grit.

title: Putah Creek 2011 Ruisseau Red (Solano County)
description: Aromas like apple skin and flavors suggesting dark cherries and boysenberry put lots of fruit concentration into this full-bodied, dry and firmly textured wine.

title: Rosa d'Oro NV Carmen Red (California)
description: This sweet and full-bodied wine was fortified and tastes rich, warm and bold. It has plummy aromas and flavors and a lingering finish.

title: Rutini 2016 Trumpeter Torrontés (Mendoza)
description: Peach-pit and stone-fruit aromas are dry and a touch bitter. Because this is so young, it's juicy and minerally in its current state, with citric acidity in the driver's seat. Nectarine and tangerine flavors finish fresh but simple.

title: Sesti 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Herbs, red berries and blue flowers come together on this zesty young red while the lean tight palate offers sour cranberry, unripe cherry and sage alongside brisk acidity. The somewhat grainy tannins leave a firm finish.

title: Silk Oak 2013 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Minty, menthol aromas and oaky sweetness create a flavorful profile for this medium-bodied wine.

title: TerraNoble 2016 Reserva Terroir El Algarrobo Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)
description: A note of grass blends with tropical aromas centered on passion fruit. Tangy, tight and citric, this offers flavors of green apple, tangerine, lemon and passion fruit. A light streak of green works its way onto the finish.

title: Ventosa 2013 Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)
description: Ripeness abounds in this densely plummy Pinot Noir. Full bodied and plush in style, its fruit profile suggests notes of maturity—flavors of prune and dried cherry glazed in sweet balsamic. The finish is a bit earthier, lingering on notes of spice and forest floor.

title: Vignerons de Buxy 2015 Buissonnier  (Mercurey)
description: With judicious wood aging, this is a rich wine. Red berry and red-currant fruits dominate the acidity, giving a wine that is ripe and juicy. The aftertaste brings in attractive red cherries and acidity. Drink from 2017.

title: Vignoble Malidain 2014 L'Aubrière Pinot Noir (Val de Loire)
description: Produced in the Nantes region in the western Loire, this is a perfumed, red-fruit-flavored Pinot Noir. It is soft, mature with red berries and offers attractive acidity at the end. Drink now.

title: Villa Maria 2014 Private Bin Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: For less than $20, this delivers plenty of Pinot Noir character. Cherry, cranberry and beet root aromas and flavors pick up a hint of cola on the crisp finish of this silky-textured, medium-weight wine. Drink it over the rest of 2017.

title: Waterbrook 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine seems a bit locked up at present, with aromas of garden herbs, plum and spice. The flavors show more generosity, with abundant cherry flavors backed by grainy, slightly astringent tannins.

title: Sannino 2013 Bella Vita Vineyard Syrah (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Ripples of fleshy, almost overripe, black cherry and berry are mouth-filling and plush in this voluptuous Syrah. It's amply oaked, wafting of toasted coconut, vanilla and spice. Soft, sunny acidity and feathery tannins cushion a moderately long finish.

title: Santa Julia 2015 Reserva Malbec (Valle de Uco)
description: Cherry and currant aromas come with soupy notes and a blast of animal fur. Although this is aggressive and choppy on the palate, it's loaded with grapy, slightly stewed berry and plum flavors. A similar tasting finish turns more rough and warm with airing.

title: Château Vartely 2012 D'Or Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon (Codru Region)
description: This Moldovan blend of 55% Merlot and 45% Cabernet Sauvignon is aged for 12 months in French barrels and has aromas of mint, smoke, black plum and cassis in the bouquet. In the mouth, there are flavors of black cherry preserves and black currant before the bright fruit finish.

title: Columbia Winery 2014 Riesling (Ancient Lakes)
description: The aromas are vibrant, with notes of flowers, jasmine, lime and peach. The palate drinks a hair off dry, with the concentration coming off as light but still providing interest.

title: Columbia Winery 2015 Limited Release Rosé Grenache (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: A light cherry-red color, this wine offers bright aromas of strawberry and cherry. It drinks off dry, with lightly spritzy fruit flavors that come off as a bit weighty and ponderous.

title: Corte Moschina 2013  Amarone della Valpolicella
description: This brawny, one-dimensional red offers flavors of raisin, dark spice, a note of powdered sage and the heat of evident alcohol. Bracing, grainy tannins leave a sharp finish.

title: Domaine Chenevières 2015  Chablis
description: This is a young fruit salad of a wine although one that is ready to drink for its crisp acidity and sliced apple flavor. The wine has citrus and a mineral texture as well as a bright line in zesty orange. Drink now.

title: Castle Rock 2013 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: A dark aroma like clove and wood smoke makes this full-bodied, ripe-tasting wine seem a little mysterious. It has ripe, easy blackberry and cedar flavors, a smooth texture and a very reasonable price.

title: Cave de Saumur NV De Chanceny Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)
description: Chenin Blanc dominates this attractive wine, giving a nutty, almond and honey character. Stewed pear is balanced with lime acidity in a fruity contrast. The wine is aromatic, lively and ready to drink.

title: Cave de Saumur NV La Petite Marquise Rosé Brut Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)
description: This is produced from Cabernet Franc grown on the plateau south of Saumur. Red fruits are cut with a crisper texture, with a hint of tannins as well as attractive acidity. Drink now.
